metadata.title: YouTube Thumbnail Size 2025: Dimensions, Resolution & Design Guide
metadata.description: Perfect YouTube thumbnail dimensions. Size requirements, resolution, and design best practices.

hero.headline: YouTube Thumbnail Size Guide
hero.subheadline: Get the dimensions right. Technical requirements and design best practices.

sections.content: Your thumbnail is the single most important factor in whether someone clicks. But before design, you need the technical specs right. Wrong dimensions mean YouTube will crop or compress your image, ruining your carefully crafted design. Here are the exact requirements.

content.title: 1280 x 720 pixels
content.description: Minimum resolution. 16:9 aspect ratio. Standard HD dimensions.

content.title: Under 2MB
content.description: File size limit. JPG, GIF, or PNG format accepted.

content.title: 16:9 Aspect Ratio
content.description: Must be widescreen format. Other ratios will be cropped.

sections.title: Technical Best Practices
content: Design at 1920x1080 for crispness, export at 1280x720
Use JPG for photo-based thumbnails (smaller file)
Keep important elements away from edges
Test at small sizes—that's how most viewers see it
Avoid thin text—gets lost at small sizes

content.title: Mobile Feed
content.description: Very small. Text must be large, readable. Most viewers here.

content.title: Desktop Browse
content.description: Medium size. More detail visible. Still needs clarity.

content.title: TV Apps
content.description: Large display. Low quality shows. Design for sharpness.

sections.title: Design Workflow
content: Use guides for safe zones (10% margin)
Design with mobile viewing in mind
Test at thumbnail size before finalizing
Export as PNG for best quality

faq.question: Can I use higher resolution?
faq.answer: Yes, but it will be scaled down. 1920x1080 works well—same aspect ratio, sharper source. YouTube compresses all thumbnails.

faq.question: Why is my thumbnail blurry?
faq.answer: Either source resolution too low, heavy JPEG compression, or too much fine detail. Use PNG for text, ensure 1280x720 minimum.

faq.question: GIF thumbnails work?
faq.answer: YouTube accepts GIF format but displays as static image. No animated thumbnails allowed currently.

faq.question: Best format for quality?
faq.answer: PNG for graphics and text, JPG for photos. PNG is lossless but larger files. JPG compresses more.
